support_summary: The ubiquitin-interacting motifs (UIMs) of ATXN3 directly interact with the heat shock cognate 71 kDa protein (HSC70, Hsc70-4 in Drosophila), an interaction that enhances ATXN3 aggregation and toxicity. [32]

functions.cellular_process: The ubiquitin-interacting motifs (UIMs) of polyglutamine-expanded ATXN3 directly interact with the heat shock cognate 71 kDa protein (HSC70, specifically Hsc70-4 in Drosophila). This interaction paradoxically enhances the aggregation and pathogenic toxicity of mutant ATXN3.
functions.effect_description: Contrary to the canonical protective role of chaperones which typically suppress protein aggregation, HSC70 binding to mutant ATXN3 exacerbates its pathogenic properties. This suggests a non-canonical, pathological chaperone-substrate interaction where HSC70 facilitates the misfolding cascade or sequestration of polyQ-expanded ATXN3 into toxic aggregates.
biological_consequence: HSC70 binds to the UIMs of polyQ-expanded ATXN3 → The propensity of ATXN3 to form SDS-resistant species and aggregates is increased → Enhanced ATXN3 aggregation leads to increased cellular toxicity and neurodegeneration.
specific_effects: The interaction is dependent on the UIMs of ATXN3.
HSC70 (Hsc70-4) enhances the aggregation and toxicity of polyQ-expanded ATXN3.
Genetic reduction of Hsc70-4 levels diminishes ATXN3-mediated toxicity in a UIM-dependent manner.

evidence.paper_title: Ubiquitin-interacting motifs of ataxin-3 regulate its polyglutamine toxicity through Hsc70-4-dependent aggregation
evidence.relevant_quote: We found that ataxin-3 pathogenicity is saliently controlled by polyglutamine-adjacent ubiquitin-interacting motifs (UIMs) that enhance aggregation and toxicity. UIMs function by interacting with the heat shock protein, Hsc70-4, whose reduction diminishes ataxin-3 toxicity in a UIM-dependent manner.

mechanism: The ubiquitin-interacting motifs (UIMs) of polyglutamine-expanded ATXN3 directly interact with the heat shock cognate 71 kDa protein (HSC70, specifically Hsc70-4 in Drosophila). This interaction paradoxically enhances the aggregation and pathogenic toxicity of mutant ATXN3.
effect: Contrary to the canonical protective role of chaperones which typically suppress protein aggregation, HSC70 binding to mutant ATXN3 exacerbates its pathogenic properties. This suggests a non-canonical, pathological chaperone-substrate interaction where HSC70 facilitates the misfolding cascade or sequestration of polyQ-expanded ATXN3 into toxic aggregates.
summary: ATXN3 activates HSC70 to modulate atxn3 aggregation and toxicity enhancement, ultimately affecting enhanced atxn3 aggregation leads to increased cellular toxicity and neurodegeneration.
